info.description:
CREALOGIX Digital Banking Hub: Asset Custody Account API
**Custody-Account-API** offers access to custody account data.
# Paging #
If the result of request is a list, it may be split in pages using the __size__ parameter.
In this case the result provides the standard HAL page __resource links__ (__first__, __last__, __next__, __previous__ and __self__). A __page meta data__ summary (__page number__, __page size__, __total number of pages__ and __total number of items__) is also provided.
# Custody Accounts - General Entry Points #
The main entry point `/cuacs` provides a simple list of all custody accounts  visible according to the calling party's permissions. 

The optional parameter __customerId__ restricts the result to the custody accounts owned by a customers.
The optional parameter __portfolioId__ restricts the result to the custody accounts contained into the given portfolio.

Each __portfolio__ provides a __link__ to the __customer information__, to the __portfolio__, to the __positions__ and to the __transactions__.  A __self__ link is also available.
# Custody Account Positions End Points #
* `/cuacs/{cuacsId}/positions` provides a list of positions visible after applying the calling party's permissions.  
* `/cuacs/{cuacsId}/positions/{positionId}` provides a single position.

The optional parameter __depositoryId__ restricts the result to the positions having the same depository.
The optional parameter __securityId__ restricts the result to the positions having the same security.

Each __position__ provides a __link__ to the __custody account__, to the __depository__, to the __security__, and to the __transactions__. A __self__ link is also available.
# Custody Account Transactions End Points #
* `/cuacs/{cuacId}/transactions` provides the list of custody account transactions.
* `/cuacs/{cuacId}/transactions/{transactionId}` provides a custody account transaction.

The optional parameter __orderId__ restricts the result to all transaction belonging to the same order.
The optional parameter __positionId__ restricts the result to all transactions belonging to a custody account position.

Each __transaction__ provides a __link__ to the __custody account__, to the __repository__, to the __order__, to the __position__ and to the __security__. A __self__ link is also available.

parameters.name: transactionId
parameters.description: The implementation internal identifier, session based

CustodyAccountDto.description:
The custody account.
* valueCustodyCurrency  : is the value of the custody account in the account's currency.
* valueCustomerCurrency : is the value of the custody account in the customer preferred currency.
* valuePortfolioCurrency: is the value of the custody account in the portfolio's currency.
* yearEndValue          : is the last end of year value of the custody account in the account's currency.

custodyAccountNumber.description: arbitrary, business related, unique bank identification number.

lastChangeAt.description: The date of the last valuation, ISO 8601 date and time.

CustodyAccountPositionDto.description:
A positon of a custody account.
* amount: amount in the unit defined by the security.

calculationFrom.description: date and time of the valuation, ISO 8601 date and time

exportTime.description: date and time when the data was exported by the banking system, ISO 8601 date and time.

salePermitted.description: sale permission, true if permitted, otherwise false.

CustodyAccountPositionPageDto.description: Paging element for custody account's positions.

CustodyAccountTransactionDto.description:
A transaction of a custody account.
* amount  : transaction amount in the unit defined by the security.

narrative.description: may be a lomg text containing the transaction details.
narrative.example: DEUTSCHE ELEKTROAPPARATUR, OBENSTRASSE 4 MUNCHEN, OCMT/EUR1088.41, CHGS/SHA/EUR20,00, FAKTURA 333/2018

transactionKey.description: Unique transaction key of the banking system.

transactionNumber.description: Unique identification of the custody account transaction.

CustodyAccountTransactionPageDto.description: Paging element for custody account's transactions.

DebitCreditCodeType.description:
Type of custody account transaction.
IRRELEVANT means that it is not relevant for the balance (e.g. coupons).

_timestamp.description: The exact date and time when the response was received, ISO 8601 date and time.

_status.description: Shows if the message was successful or contains errors. This is mostly helpful for early processing by javascript clients. Status depends also on HTTP-Status codes (HTTP-Code != 2xx = false).

StatusMessageDto.description: Common response message object (Optional for success messages).

path.description:
* JSON path for field validation. If not set, the message is a global message. If this field is set the text contains the field specific message.
* Elements of the JSON-structure will be separated by "." and arrays will be represented with [].

StatusMessageCategoryType.description: Category, which defines the severity of the message.
